label: HubSpot Conversations API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Hubspot Conversations API

tools.name: ArchiveConversationThread
tools.description:
Archives a conversation thread, marking it for deletion.

Use this tool to archive a conversation thread, which will then be permanently deleted after 30 days. Ideal for managing conversational data efficiently by removing unnecessary threads.

parameters.name: thread_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the conversation thread to archive. This is a required field and should match the specific thread you wish to archive.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateChannelAccount
tools.description:
Create a new account for a specified communication channel.

This tool is used to create a new account within a specific communication channel using Hubspot. It enables multiple accounts to communicate over a single channel with different delivery identifiers.

parameters.name: account_name
parameters.description: The name of the account to be created for the channel. It identifies the account within the specified communication channel.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the communication channel where the account will be created. This should be a string value.

parameters.name: inbox_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the inbox where the channel account will be created. This should be a string that corresponds to an existing inbox in Hubspot.

parameters.name: is_authorized
parameters.description: Boolean to indicate if the account should be authorized. Set to true for authorized accounts, false otherwise.

parameters.name: delivery_identifier_type
parameters.description: Type of identifier: HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS, HS_PHONE_NUMBER, or CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID.

parameters.name: delivery_identifier_value
parameters.description: A string representation of the delivery identifier. Can be an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

parameters.name: channel_account_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the HubSpot channel account to retrieve details for. This ID is required to fetch the channel account's information.

parameters.name: message_id

tools.name: PublishCustomChannelMessage
tools.description:
Publish a message to a custom channel on HubSpot.

    This tool sends a message over a specified custom channel in HubSpot Conversations. Use this tool to communicate via custom-integrated messaging channels.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: custom_channel_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the custom channel where the message will be published. Must be a string.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: SendConversationMessage
tools.description:
Send a new message in a conversation thread.

    Use this tool to send a new message on an existing conversation thread. Ideal for continuing discussions or replying within a thread.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the conversation thread where the message will be sent. It should be a string that corresponds to the existing thread ID in Hubspot.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"message":"Hello, how can I assist you today?"}

tools.name: UpdateChannelAccountInfo
tools.description:
Update channel account name and authorization status.

Use this tool to modify the name and authorization status of a channel account in Hubspot Conversations. This is useful for managing channel accounts, including disabling them by setting the isAuthorized flag to False.

parameters.name: channel_account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the channel account to be updated. It is required for specifying which channel account to modify.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the channel in Hubspot Conversations. Required to specify which channel account to update.

parameters.name: channel_account_name
parameters.description: The new name for the channel account. This updates the display name associated with the account.

tools.description:
Update channel account staging token details for public apps.

This tool updates the account name and delivery identifier of a channel account staging token in Hubspot Conversations. Use it when you need to modify these details for a specific channel account created from a staging token.

parameters.description: The name of the account to be updated for the channel account staging token.

parameters.name: account_token
parameters.description: The unique token identifying the specific channel account staging. Required for updating account details.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the channel to update. This is necessary to specify which channel's staging token details are being modified.

parameters.name: delivery_identifier_type
parameters.description: Type of delivery identifier: HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS, HS_PHONE_NUMBER, or CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID.

parameters.name: delivery_identifier_value
parameters.description: The PublicDeliveryIdentifier in string format, such as an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

tools.name: UpdateConversationThread
tools.description:
Update the status or restore a conversation thread.

This tool updates a single thread's status or restores it within Hubspot Conversations. Use it to change the status or restore a thread based on the thread ID provided.

parameters.name: thread_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the conversation thread to update or restore.

parameters.name: is_thread_archived
parameters.description: Set to true to archive or false to restore the thread. Determines if the thread is currently archived.

tools.name: UpdateMessageStatus
tools.description:
Update the status of a conversation message.

Use this tool to update the status of a message within a custom channel on Hubspot Conversations. It indicates whether a message was successfully sent, failed, or read. Additionally, for failed messages, you can include an error message for clarification.

parameters.name: channel_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the custom channel where the message is located. It is required to specify which channel the message belongs to.

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the message to be updated.

parameters.name: message_status
parameters.description: Specifies the status of the message. Valid values are SENT, FAILED, and READ.

parameters.name: error_message_for_failed_status
parameters.description: Provide an error message when the status is FAILED to clarify the reason for failure. Only use this when 'statusType' is 'FAILED'.

summary:
HubspotConversationsApi enables seamless interactions with HubSpot's Conversations API, allowing for efficient management of conversation data. Developers can leverage this toolkit to execute various functionalities within HubSpot Conversations directly.

**Capabilities**
- Archive and manage conversation threads for data efficiency.
- Create and retrieve details about channel accounts and inboxes.
- Publish and manage custom channel messages.
- Access detailed message history and conversation participants.
- Update statuses and configurations for conversation threads and messages.

**OAuth**
- **Provider:** Unknown  
- **Scopes:** conversations.custom_channels.read, conversations.custom_channels.write, conversations.read, conversations.write.

**Secrets**
- No secrets exist for this toolkit.
